title: Lets face it: Mordekaiser's ult will become a balancing nightmare.
body:
First things first.
I absolutely LOVE the fantasy behing fighting for your life against a literal avatar of death (and metal), but on the other hand i can already see serious abuse potential in it.

**Problem No. 1 "A worthy oponent."**
Lets face the sad truth. How often will we see {{champion:82}} willingly targeting feed {{champion:266}} / {{champion:24}} / {{champion:11}}... with his ult?
Do you know who will be targeted insted? Champions that cant defend themselves and cant run away.
"Lets challenge this {{champion:350}} / {{champion:16}} / {{champion:40}} / 0/10 {{champion:157}}  , they definitely looks like a good and fair fight."
______________________________________________

**Problem No. 2 "What happens in death realm stays in death realm... unless we are premade."**
Imagine a simple situation. You play on top vs {{champion:82}}. You killed him already and you are ahead in cs, he is no threat to you. You just spotted enemy jungler, {{champion:120}}, heading toward toplane so you turn around to evacuate to your turrent but then Morde ults you. He is not engaging you, he knows he cant win... but he can wait for his premade jungler to take good position on the other side. What do you do? Fight him? Even if you win there is his teammate waiting for you. Well, you can at last count on that his teammate will not know where you will reappear, right? Worng, they are on voice chat so he knows exactly where you are. GG fair duel.
______________________________________________

**Problem No. 3 "Scrifacial {{champion:82}}"**
Another sitauation. You hard carry your team... 20/3/5 on {{champion:11}}, feels good. Just one more teamfight and the game game is yours. You go in and... poof, you are stuck in this death realm with this useless 0/10 "support" {{champion:82}}  that went full tank.... How long will it take to kill him? 4-5s max. Once you are done with him you ready yourself to go into the teamfight... but your team is gone. Without it's only carry your teammates were decimated in seconds. Enemy team "traded" one support for one extermally feed carry. A worthy trade.
______________________________________________

 **Problem No. 4 "Left to die"**
And last situation. You and 2 other members of your team ecounter 4 members of enemy team (dragon/herald fight or whatever). Your team disengages and everyone is almost safe but then enemy {{champion:82}} ults you. This leaves 2 v 3 on the outside... your team decides to run for thier lives and leave you for certain death once you reappear, even if you menage to kill Morde there are 3 enemies waiting for you (or they are Irons and decide to go back 2v3 to save you... and all 3 of you die :D).

One last thing... imagine all this in Proplay. Pros are gonna hate this champ. 
Not that i care about esport nowadays anyway.

It doesn't matter, Taking a key ulti out of the game for 7 seconds is absolutely amazing. I can't believe you are underestimating how good this is. Imagine the only counter engage the enemy team has is Alistar? You ult him and oiala, you win the engagement war.

The strength behind this ability is that you can look at your team and the enemy team, and go "what's our problem", and then remove the problem entirely. This ability can straight up win games regardless of position in the game. Even if you don't kill the person you ult, its still 4-7 seconds of CC where they can't do anything. Do not underestimate this.
yea, not even Camilla Ult is as powerful as this and we all know how powerful Camilla ult is when she single out your carry.

Taking a Janna out of a fight for free is huge.

Taking out the support by trading the toplaner is... not so much. You're removing the main person Janna has to peel.

The mid laner?

Or the jungler?
The fed ap darius
The Yasuo's 0/10 power spike.

OR you could take Draven or Tristana out of the fight, and there goes a huge amount of damage.

Imagine taking the fed guy out of the fight: then maybe your team has a shot at winning the 4v4. Sure they still have their peel, but if the enemy just peels away, they leave poor Draven or whoever to be mopped up by the rest of Morde's team. Decent trade for a team, especially a team who is behind. 

And if the team is ahead, then Morde can just 1v1 the carry with no Janna peel instead.

Or that Draven or Tristana kills you in a couple of seconds and now they're full health vs your 2 surviving allies with 10% HP each, handing the game over to the enemy on  a silver platter. It could go both ways.

I honestly still think that is better than Realm warping an enchanter. Enchanters typically have more self-peel than your average adc, so Morde is probably going to punk on them a little bit. He's got natural tankiness with his W. Plus, even if Morde only lasts a few seconds, that's still a few seconds that the 4v4 happens, taking their main damage dealer out of the fight. Could be longer if Morde has Zhonya's or something. 

I think its ok if that doesn't always happen, because that means its somewhat balanced: he's still useful if his team is behind, but its not a free win or anything like that.

> There's little value in taking a support AND yourself out of the game. On top of that the only stats you receive are base stats.

In a teamfight that might be a bad idea to trade Morde for a support but outside of teamfights... just a free kill.
And now a plot twist: What if Mordekaiser IS a support?
 
> That's part of playing vs. him. You can't say Lissandra is unbalanced because she can use her ultimate in coordination with a jungler. Anyone can, especially if it's a crowd control type. Also, I imagine while he's there he can't see or deliver pings either.

Lissandra's ult lasts for 2s, death realm lasts for 7s. Thats a huge diffference.

> ? How is this a problem.
> 
> Mordekaiser will be decimated before he even gets remotely close to you, unless he gets off a good flank or your positioning is shit. 

Morde doesn't need to get close to you, its ranged point and click cc.

> And in this case what's to stop a crowd control tank or support from doing the exact same thing?

Right now most cc was already converted into skill shoots so you could at last try to dodge them. On top of that there is no other cc that lasts 7s.
------------------------------------

All in all what I fear the most is not that there are some abuse cases to his new ultimate but that it will be solely used for this purpose - not as a glorious "1v1 me bro" but as a cheap form of cc. So all this fantasy behing Lord of Death and Suffering will be reduced in reality to "imma support in pro play hurr durr" and soon after Rito will start to balance him for this new disgraceful role.

>Lissandra's ult lasts for 2s, death realm lasts for 7s. Thats a huge diffference.

Lisandras causes you to be stuck in place, mordes forces you into an area that nearly covers the full length of toplane so unless you pushed up to his tower, you will be able to get to the tower, or at least very close to it.
Remember all this when Mord gets hot fixed =)

I don't really see a problem with any of these, particularly problems 2 and 3. These are just strengths offered to him from his ultimate. 

Problem 2: not really any different from a premade preparing with a Lissandra ult or some other form of CC for Hecarim to come gank.

Problem 3: oh no, poor Yi can't hard carry on his own. Boo hoo. If a carry can be fed, there have to be ways and strategies to deal with it. Hard CC is really good against Yi (and most carries), this is just the hardest of hard CC. Camille's ult is similar, she can stop an ADC from positioning properly.
Wouldn't be surprised tbh

It would probably be a numbers issue, I don't see Morde being the Akali/Aatrox/Ryze levels of broken when it comes to the core kit. 

What would be the reason to pick Morde over them in a competitive setting?

Remember this is basically Poppy's old ult but the difference is that it becomes 4v4 instead of 5v4. And you can just kite around him in his ult too.


We'll see though

The problem is that he gets to choose which champion from the enemy team to remove from the fight.  If the enemy team has a fed Assassin/Diver that can instagib your ADC, then you can just ult them out of the teamfight and then let your ADC have free reign over the teamfight.  It doesn't matter that Morde is no longer in the fight because there is nothing to stop your ADC from killing the entire enemy team.  He can remove the enemy support protecting the ADC, the mid laner that provides all of the utility, or even just remove the ADC altogether so the enemy team doesn't have any damage to win the teamfight with.

This may not be valuable in the chaotic realm of solo Q, but this kind of disruption can be very valuable in a coordinated setting like pro play.  It will always make it a 4v4, but trading your Juggernaut for the enemy ADC before the teamfight even starts is a huge difference in that 4v4.  I'm not gonna go out and say that it will 100% be problematic in high elo and suck ass in the lower brackets, but considering the last 3 or 4 reworks have all been pro play nightmares I wouldn't be surprised if it did end up being overpowered.  We still have to wait and see though.

It's a 1v1 setting where any heals/sheilds (if i understood correctly) are negated.
Which means that against Morde, you're gonna have to either fight him if you know you can win or kite him, if you're the priority target and want to avoid giving your stats to him.


Morde is also being evacuated from a fight so even if he wins but his team loses, he gets dropped in a 1v4, likely already bruised up in his previous scuffle. Yea, he can ult that Soraka or Janna for an easy teamfight removal but the cost is that he's also removed from a fight, if he's strong. So the idea here would be that if you want to get back to the fight sooner, you have to kill or be killed. And Morde still doesn't have any MS/dashes or blinks at his disposal, meaning that mobile enough champs could still kite his ass and run circles around him.

As far as i'm hearing, Cleanse or QSS would still be an option for removing his R curse (maybe not Cleanse). Which would mean that Morde's best use case scenarios for his ult would be to pick a fight he could win, against a champion that would be fighting him instead of running away.

Riot at least has perspective on how strong this kind of ult is, so I give them the benefit of the doubt for now

Poppy's VGU left out her iconic ultimate because it wasn't healthy for the game, and it made her unable to be buffed anywhere because of how stupid powerful it was to just choose any enemy champion and make it a 1v1 for an indefinite amount of time.
